messages.content: How many grams of sencha per 150g water?

For brewing Sencha, a common ratio is about 2 grams of tea leaves per 150 ml (grams) of water. This ratio can be adjusted based on personal taste preferences, with more leaves for a stronger brew or fewer for a lighter one. Remember, these are guidelines and experimenting with different ratios can help you find your preferred strength.

For brewing Sencha, the recommended water temperature is between 70째C to 80째C (158째F to 176째F). Steeping time typically ranges from 1 to 2 minutes. Starting with a shorter steeping time and adjusting based on your taste preference is a good approach. Over-steeping can result in a bitter flavor, so it's best to keep an eye on the time.
